title: BBC Local Live: Coventry & Warwickshire - BBC News

text: wasps 21-24 harlequins

text: jurassic locomotive back on tracks

documents.title: gurning world champions unveiled
text: gurning world champions unveiled

documents.title: cambridge united 2-1 coventry city
text: cambridge united 2-1 coventry city

documents.title: pet shop chain to go into administration
text: pet shop chain to go into administration

documents.title: bears must aim to do an essex - giles
text: bears must aim to do an essex - giles

documents.title: our coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather updates from 08:00 on monday .

documents.title: weather : some showers tomorrow , but sunday looking dry
text: we 're going to have a few more showers tomorrow afternoon , but it 's looking a lot drier on sunday .
author: Rebecca Wood
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: women 's super rugby : midlands teams in new competition
text: three west midlands women 's rugby teams are preparing for fixtures in a newly-established elite competition this weekend .
it 's hoped women 's super rugby will help double female participation in the sport .
the rugby football union will make a multi-million pound investment in the competition 's first three years .
the midlands boasts three of the ten teams ; worcester valkyries , gloucester hartpury women and wasps ladies .
author: BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: sky blues prepare for trip to face cambridge united
text: the sky blues have no fresh injury concerns ahead of tomorrow 's trip to cambridge united .
city do have defender rod macdonald available again after serving his one-match suspension midweek as they go into the game fourth in league two .
manager mark robins said the current team `` are a good group that are wanting to fight and scrap for each other and dig in when they have to '' .
author: BBC Coventry & Warwickshire Sport

documents.title: cathedral service for man killed at coventry petrol station
text: the funeral has been taking place of a coventry man who died at a petrol station .
mark nesmith , 35 , was found stabbed at the bp garage in the butts in june .
mourners at coventry cathedral were asked by his family to `` wear brightly coloured clothes '' and come with `` a big smile on their faces '' .
three men have been charged with the murder of the tattoo artist .
those who pray , please remember mark nesmith & those who love him as we gather for his funeral @ twitterid rest in peace & rise in glory
thank you for a beautiful service .

documents.title: travel : rail delays through rugby
text: there are delays of up to 15 minutes on london midland services through rugby due to a vehicle hitting a bridge in the area , the operator says .
please note due to a road vehicle colliding with a bridge a rugby , trains are running at reduced speed in this area .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: consortium plans legal challenge if local plan gets green light
text: just days before it is set to be approved , warwick district 's local plan could face a legal challenge from a consortium of parish councils and groups which are aiming to halt certain development projects and to protect green belt land .
author: Warwick Courier

documents.title: middlesex bowling effort relegates bears
text: middlesex bowling effort relegates bears

documents.title: rugby woman spent 36 'horrific ' hours huddled in bathroom
text: a survivor of hurricane irma who moved from rugby to tortola just five months ago spent 36 'horrific ' hours huddled in a shower cubicle as her new home was torn apart around her .
author: Rugby & Lutterworth Observer

documents.title: premiership : wasps squad announced to take on harlequins
text: nathan huges is set to make his 100th appearance for wasps - he 's named in the squad to face harlequins at the ricoh arena this sunday .
fellow internationals elliot daly and james haskell also return .
team news : dai young names his team to face @ twitterid in @ twitterid at the @ twitterid this sunday , ko 3pm !
is @ twitterid injured ?
it 's all in the story john -
was n't loading for me so thought i 'd ask as easier
great team and great to see daly and @ twitterid back .
shame gopperth is injured , but it 's a strong bench !
go get em boys !
i think you misspelt cipriani .
i think what you meant to spell was @ twitterid can you please amend and re-post .
thanks xx
the strength of the full @ twitterid squad is beyond ridiculous !
such a a great 23 with so much other quality still missing !
josh bassett ? ?
would prefer @ twitterid at full back and just noticed @ twitterid what a squad coyw
great to see @ twitterid back and @ twitterid on the bench coyw
really strong side , strong bench too .
great to see daly and hasks back # coyw
jeez loads of up front and a backline on with
nice ! ! ! ! !
where 's @ twitterid ?

documents.title: nuneaton council house sold to make way for new flats
text: after more than a year on the market , nuneaton and bedworth borough council has struck a deal to sell the former council house .
author: Nuneaton News

documents.title: three remain in custody after police-pursuit crash
text: three men arrested following a collision on hinckley road , nuneaton , yesterday have been released from hospital and are in police custody .
the crash , involving three cars - one of which was being pursued by police - happened just before 13:00 .
the three men , aged 22 , 25 and 26 , and all from coventry , have been arrested on sus of aggravated taking of a vehicle and a house burglary .

documents.title: moving to holland so son can take cannabis for epilepsy
text: on this week 's front page : a mum is moving her family to holland so her five-year-old son who suffers with severe epilepsy can be legally treated with medical cannabis .
author: Stratford Observer

documents.title: ice hockey : blaze players graduate
text: coventry blaze assistant captain kevin noble , along with four former players , have successfully graduated from the coventry university business school with masters degrees .
the club has had a partnership with the university since 2002 , allowing players to combine studying with ice hockey .
the club said the partnership proves crucial to their recruitment process and has allowed many players to enhance their career prospects once their skating days are over .
congratulations to @ twitterid graduates @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid and kevin noble :
well deserved @ twitterid

documents.title: two treated at scene of nuneaton fire
text: two people were treated by ambulance crews at the scene of the serious fire in nuneaton this morning .
the blaze happened at an industrial unit on tuttle hill .
a man believed to be in his 40s was treated for the effects of smoke inhalation and discharged at the scene .
a woman , also around the same age , was treated for the effects of shock .
we told you earlier how a cordon was put in place around the site and a nearby school evacuated .

documents.title: cyclist suffers serious injury in honeybourne crash
text: a cyclist was seriously injured when his bike crashed with a land rover on buckle street , honeybourne , police say .
the 16-year-old was taken to hospital with a head injury after the crash on thursday at about 13:20 .

documents.title: nuneaton fire : school to remain closed
text: there will be no lessons at camp hill primary school for the rest of the day following a nearby fire this morning , the local authority says .

children at the site were taken to a church and community centre , although the school is no longer within the exclusion zone imposed by police following the blaze at tuttle hill industrial estate in nuneaton .
the school will remain open as a rest centre for those children whose parents have not been able to collect them , the council says .
emergency services were called to the fire at about 09:00 .
2/2 those children who could not be collected will be able to stay at the school which will still be open in this capacity
1/2 camp hill school will be closed for the rest of the day after being evacuated earlier this morning due to fire at tuttle hill , nuneaton
author: Vanessa Pearce
BBC Local Live

documents.title: cricket : bears ' giles speaks of 'hard work in division two '
text: warwickshire 's sport director ashley giles says only hard work will get the bears out of division two of the county championship next season .
the bears ' relegation should be confirmed today after they were beaten by an innings and 56 runs against essex yesterday .

giles told the bbc : `` it 's going to take some hard work and we need guys who are truly on board for that hard work because if anyone thinks it 's just going to be easy jumping back up from division two , they 've got another thing coming . ''
he is hoping former captain ian bell [ above ] will stay at edgbaston and put a difficult season behind him next year .
belly coming out of that england environment , [ it ] sometimes can be really tough to make that transition to county cricket .

we know he 's class , consistently putting [ in ] those performances for the bears and for england and more than anything we just want to see him happy and he 's happy when he 's scoring runs and we 're winning matches , so that 's what we 've got to try and get him back to . ''

documents.title: social media inquiry launched
text: the government 's attorney general is considering whether tougher penalties are needed to stop people jeopardising criminal trials by posting comments on social media .

jeremy wright , the conservative mp for kenilworth and southam , has asked judges , lawyers , police and victims ' groups to submit evidence about their experience of legal cases , rulings and investigations being affected by online messages in england and wales .
he said there was already some evidence that comments - on platforms such as facebook and twitter - had undermined legal proceedings .

documents.title: nuneaton fire : evacuated schoolchildren taken to church
text: a local community centre and church are being used as a base for children from camp hill primary school which was evacuated after a nearby fire this morning .
a school statement sought to reassure parents that children were taken there `` as a precaution '' and that all children were safe .
author: Vanessa Pearce
BBC Local Live

documents.title: nuneaton fire : police cordon downsized
text: the police cordon around the fire at tuttle hill industrial estate is being downsized , police say , meaning that camp hill primary school - evacuated this morning - no longer falls within the exclusion zone .
warwickshire county council says it is not yet sure whether the school will re-open today .
the cordon around fire at tuttle hill , nuneaton has now been reduced to 50m by wfrs , meaning camp hill school is no longer included
author: Vanessa Pearce
BBC Local Live

documents.title: school evacuated in nuneaton fire
text: camp hill school in nuneaton was evacuated due to the fire on tuttle hill industrial estate , police said .
officers co-ordinated the evacuation after being called to the site at about 09:00 .
pupils had only just returned to school after it was closed for two days when travellers moved onto nearby land .
residents of two homes close to the blaze have also been asked to leave .
four appliances are currently at a garage fire on tuttle hill , nuneaton .
two firefighters using ba to locate source of fire .

documents.title: large fire closes nuneaton road
text: fire crews and police are at the scene of a large fire at a garage on tuttle hill industrial estate in nuneaton .
there are road closures in place and police are asking people to avoid the area .
fire on tuttle hill industrial estate , nuneaton , 200m exclusion zone in place , roads closed , please avoid the area

documents.title: car crime spree prompts police warning
text: ten seconds is all a thief needs to break into a car - that is the warning from police as they revealed car crime rose by over 20 per cent in warwickshire during the summer .
author: Rugby & Lutterworth Observer

documents.title: warning that police cuts could cover pay rise
text: police commissioners are warning that the number of police officers working in the midlands could be reduced by almost a hundred to fund a pay rise .
it 's estimated a total of 97 posts could go between the west midlands , west mercia and warwickshire forces .
earlier this week the government confirmed officers would get a 1 % pay increase and a 1 % bonus .
the staffordshire force is considering using its reserves .
author: BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: sight-saving surgeon recognised with honorary professorship
text: south warwickshire nhs foundation trust consultant ophthalmologist gary misson has been recognised for his extensive work improving the sight of people who suffer from eye conditions .
author: Stratford Observer

documents.title: gun amnesty follows city centre shooting
text: police are urging people to hand in firearms .

the west midlands force hopes its gun surrender project `` will stop unused shotguns or antique firearms - often world war relics gathering dust in loft spaces - from potentially falling into the hands of criminals '' .
police say people can hand in any firearm - including handguns , shotguns , rifles , bb guns , imitations , ammunition or antiques - without fear of being prosecuted for gun possession .
guns can be surrendered anonymously but the history of live weapons handed in will be checked for any evidence of criminal use .
the campaign allows people to surrender weapons at a police station or to request an officer to collect them .
it comes after a 34-year-old man was shot dead in hockley , birmingham , on wednesday night .
the last west midlands police firearms surrender in july 2014 saw the seizure of 131 firearms and more than 1,000 rounds of ammunition .

documents.title: train services to london disrupted
text: train services to birmingham through coventry are disrupted following an overnight fire at a factory in north-west london .
there are currently no services on london midland and southern between milton keynes central and euston .
there are currently no direct trains to london euston from birmingham .
some virgin trains are expected to run , but network rail says they will terminate before euston .
tickets are being accepted on chiltern railway services via birmingham between coventry and reading .
some @ twitterid are expected to run , however are subject to alteration & will terminate before euston ( rugby or mk central ) ^sk
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: video : your 50-second weather forecast
text: after a chilly start it will be a bright day with sunny spells with the chance of a few showers this afternoon .
feeling cool for september with top temperatures of 16c ( 61f ) .
author: Sara Blizzard
BBC Weather

documents.title: good morning from the coventry newsroom
text: welcome to our live service for coventry and warwickshire .
we 'll bring you all the latest news , sport , travel and weather updates throughout the day .
if you 'd like to get in touch with the bbc local live team , you can do so by emailing us , tweeting @ twitterid or visiting our facebook page .
author: Vanessa Pearce
BBC Local Live

documents.title: police-pursuit crash referred to watchdog
text: police-pursuit crash referred to watchdog

documents.title: our coverage across the day
text: live updates for coventry and warwickshire have now ended .
we 'll be back with you from 08:00 tomorrow , but keep an eye out for updated stories and breaking news .

documents.title: sir james dyson vows to tackle shortfall of female engineers
text: sir james dyson said 27 % of the graduates enrolled in his privately funded university are women and he vowed to boost the number of female engineers .
the billionaire founder of dyson plans to drive the number up to 50 % in coming years , as part of his crusade to tackle britain 's dearth of engineering talent .
the student engineers have begun a four-year degree , during which they will be mentored by dyson 's scientists and engineers who will teach alongside academics from warwick university .

documents.title: cricket : giles talks of change with the bears ' relegation all but confirmed
text: warwickshire sport director ashley giles [ below ] says it 's a chance to `` go back and start again '' after their relegation to division two of the county championship was all but confirmed with defeat to champions-elect essex .
they were beaten by an innings and 56 runs at edgbaston after being bowled out for 112 in their second innings .
certainly we 're gon na go through some change and perhaps the best place to do it is the second division .
two out of eight now [ going down means it 's ] tough to stay in division one .
everyone 's going to take their medicine at some point and go down and we 've spent 10 years in division one and played some very good cricket and won some trophies . ''

documents.title: weather : more rain tonight and tomorrow
text: we are forecast more showers overnight and that weather is set to continue tomorrow , with the odd bright spell at times .
author: Shefali Oza
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: family moving to holland to get medical cannabis treatment for severely epileptic son
text: on our front page this week : a mum is moving her family to holland so her five year-old son who suffers with severe epilepsy can be legally treated with medical cannabis .
author: Leamington Observer

documents.title: three arrested after 'stolen ' car overturns in police pursuit
text: the car that overturned , injuring three people in nuneaton this afternoon , was subject to a `` short police pursuit '' , the force has said .
the three , who were travelling in a stolen vw golf were taken to hospital , but are not seriously injured .
all three have been arrested and the ipcc has been informed , officers said .
local councillor , keith kondakor has tweeted this of the crash scene .
there has been a very serious crash on hinckley road nuneaton between collage and higham lane .
i expect the road will be closed for a time
hi - i 'm from bbc online .
are we alright to use your of the scene , with a credit , please ?

documents.title: coventry bus crash : company admits failing to ensure safety of employees and public
text: a bus company that 's admitted health and safety failings in relation to a fatal bus crash in coventry is found to have failed to ensure the safety of employees between april 2015 and the day of the crash six months later .

the second charge midland red pleaded guilty to stated that it failed to ensure members of the public were not exposed to risks to their safety arising out of the driving of public service vehicles by driver kailash chander .
rowan fitzgerald , aged seven , and 76-year-old pedestrian dora hancox both died in the crash .
rowan , of leamington spa , was on the upper deck with his grandparents and his cousin , an eight-year-old girl who was seriously hurt .
ms hancox was a was a lollipop lady in coventry and nuneaton and had dedicated many years of her life as a foster carer for coventry social services , her family said .
five other people required hospital treatment after the crash in trinity street on 3 october .

documents.title: referendum for wootton wawen community to have say on developments
text: a referendum will give people in wootton wawen a chance to have their say on developments in the village .
author: Stratford Observer

documents.title: road to remain closed for police investigation after car overturns
text: police say they expect hinckley road , in nuneaton , to remain closed `` for some time '' after a car overturned , injuring three people .
the vw golf , identified as suspect by officers , hit a renault and skoda before ending up on its roof , police said .
they wo n't yet confirm whether the three people in custody have been arrested or whether the car was being pursued by a police vehicle at the time .
author: Vanessa Pearce
BBC Local Live

documents.title: breakingessex beat bears to edge closer to title
text: breakingessex beat bears to edge closer to title

documents.title: three injured after 'suspect ' car overturns
text: a car identified as suspect by police has overturned after crashing with two other vehicles in hinckley road , nuneaton .
three people have been taken to hospital , including a man in his 20s police believe was the driver of the overturned car , suffering from multiple injuries .
hinckley road remains closed between higham lane and tavistock way .
police said they identified the suspect vehicle at 11:54 and an order to use preventative tactics to stop the car was issued .
three people are currently in custody , the force said , after the crash which happened at 12:59 .

documents.title: mystery as coventry dad found dead inside disused manchester building
text: grieving relatives spoke of unanswered questions '' after a coventry dad was found dead inside a disused building .
author: Coventry Telegraph

documents.title: bus gate fines investigated
text: the use of bus gates in coventry is to be investigated after the opposition conservative party claimed thousands of drivers have been wrongly fined .
a bus gate is a junction where only buses can pass .
conservative councillor tim mayer said an independent adjudicator found that signage on the bus-only lane under the whittle arches in the city centre is n't good enough .

in 2016 a typing error in a department for transport ( dft ) authorisation letter meant signs near coventry 's railway station were not legally enforceable and up to £ 50,000 could be refunded to motorists who were wrongly fined .
the councillor in charge of city services jayne innes said she would be having a `` really good look '' at the new evidence .

documents.title: window cleaner turned hairdresser runs caravan salon for those unable to travel
text: a former window cleaner turned hairdresser is using a caravan as a mobile salon for those unable to travel .
author: Leamington Observer

documents.title: bus company admits death crash charges
text: bus company admits death crash charges

documents.title: coming up on midlands today at 13:30
text: coming up on midlands today later : it 's been described as the biggest station building programme on the railways since the victorian age .
millions of pounds are set to be spent on up to 12 new stations across the region , including the new station at kenilworth .
passenger numbers have risen by more than 60 % over the past decade and are expected to grow still further over the next few years .
you can hear the latest on the region 's rail development on our lunchtime bulletin at 13:30 on bbc one .
author: BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: coventry crash : bus company committed to crown court for sentencing
text: midland red ( south ) ltd are due to be sentenced at warwick crown court on 6 october after admitting two charges brought under the health and safety law following a fatal bus crash in coventry .
the managing director of midland red steve burd and its operations director jim mortimore attended court on behalf of the company , which is based at offices in daw bank , stockport .

the facts of the safety breaches were not opened by prosecutor michael gregory , who told district judge lesley mottram : `` the prosecution submission is that this matter is so serious that you should use your powers to commit it to the crown court for sentencing . ''
the case came a week after 79-year-old bus driver kailash chander appeared before the court charged with causing death by dangerous driving .

documents.title: bus firm expresses sorrow after fatal crash
text: the bus operator expressed its sorrow about the fatal crash after the court hearing today , in which it admitted two charges of health and safety breaches .

addressing the court after the pleas were entered , the firm 's solicitor andrew dawson expressed `` profound condolences , regret and sorrow '' over the crash , which saw a double-decker bus hit the side of a supermarket .

documents.title: breakingbus company admits failings after fatal bus crash
text: a bus operator has admitted two health and safety charges linked to the deaths of two people after a bus crash in coventry .

appearing at coventry magistrates ' court , midland red ( south ) ltd entered guilty pleas to the two charges after failing to prevent risks of `` driver error '' linked to fatigue and excessive working hours .
bus passenger rowan fitzgerald , aged seven , and 76-year-old pedestrian dora hancox were both pronounced dead at the scene of the crash in trinity street , coventry .

documents.title: lizard rescue turns out to be dirty sock
text: lizard rescue turns out to be dirty sock

documents.title: £ 1m coventry bus gate fines blasted by independent tribunal - but council ignored concerns
text: thousands more drivers could have been unfairly fined after using coventry council 's bus gates , damning independent legal adjudicator reports show .
author: Coventry Observer

documents.title: county championship : a dream start for essex
text: essex have made a good start at edgbaston with a wicket in each of jamie porter 's first two overs .
he 's still testing the warwickshire batsmen but for now the very experienced pair of jonathan trott and ian bell are keeping him out .
trott has move to six not out with one boundary , but , like bell , who is yet to get off the mark , he has been forced to be largely defensive .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: police called in to evict nuneaton travellers
text: an eviction of travellers from outside a nuneaton school is under way , said police .
the council , which owns the site on the dingle , in the town , `` requested police assistance to resolve the situation '' , said ch inspr dafydd goddard .
`` the decision was made based on a number of factors , including the disruption to the local community due to the proximity of the encampment to a local school '' , he said .
camp hill primary has been closed until further notice .

documents.title: rspca called to rescue dirty sock
text: animal rescue officers called to deal with a lizard at a house in coventry made a surprising discovery .
it was around seven inches long and about two inches wide .
it was protruding from the edge of the bed and it was n't moving at all , '' said rspca officer vic hurr .
`` as it was n't very light , i got out my torch to see better and that 's when i realised it was n't a lizard at all it was a pink stripy sock . ''

i advised the young girl whose bedroom it was to tidy her room and to take care of her socks , but not before reminding her that another one will turn up soon , as they are usually in pairs , '' she added .
author: Vanessa Pearce
BBC Local Live

documents.title: moon tales needed for documentary
text: documentary-makers are calling for people to take part in in an event at coventry cathedral celebrating the power of the moon .

collaborating with the festival of imagineers and the museum of the moon , they 're asking for 100 people , who love the moon or may have lunar tales , to take part in the filming of the show called wonders of the moon .
you can register here for the event , on thursday 28 september .
author: Vanessa Pearce
BBC Local Live

documents.title: court efforts to remove travellers
text: efforts to evict a group of travellers from land outside a nuneaton school goes to court today .
the borough council is applying to move them on after they set up camp on the dingle near camp hill primary .
the school has been closed until further notice .
a message on the school website said the decision had been taken to `` safeguard our pupils , staff and families '' .

documents.title: new jaguar electric racing cars will be made in coventry
text: jaguar has announced it is to launch the world 's first international racing championship for production-based electric cars with all the vehicles taking part made in coventry .
author: Coventry Telegraph

documents.title: students start at sir james dyson 's engineering university
text: the first students are starting a four-year engineering degree at the dyson institute of engineering and technology .
the £ 15m institute , set up by sir james dyson , is based at dyson 's campus , in wiltshire , and is a partnership with the university of warwick .
more than 850 people applied for 25 positions , so the firm increased its intake to 33 due to the `` exceptionally high-calibre of the candidates '' .
lord bhattacharyya , chairman of the warwick manufacturing group at the university of warwick , said he wanted to help `` develop a pool of talent '' with the dyson partnership .

documents.title: cricket : warwickshire edge closer to relegation
text: warwickshire resume on seven without loss , chasing 168 to make essex bat again , on day three of their county championship match at edgbaston .
the visitors declared on 369 yesterday .
if lancashire lose at somerset , essex will be crowned champions for the first time since 1992 with victory , with warwickshire edging closer to relegation .
play is due to begin at 10:30 and you can follow updates here .

documents.title: video : your 50-second weather forecast
text: after a showery start for some there should be some brighter spells before the rain returns this afternoon .
we can expect top temperatures of about 17c ( 63f ) .
author: Alex Hamilton
BBC Weather

documents.title: live updates for coventry and warwickshire
text: welcome to our live service for thursday .
we 'll bring you all the latest news , sport , travel and weather updates throughout the day .
if you 'd like to get in touch with the bbc local live team , you can do so by emailing us , tweeting @ twitterid or visiting our facebook page .
author: Vanessa Pearce
BBC Local Live

documents.title: pc told man 'you 're the first i 'd shoot '
text: pc told man 'you 're the first i 'd shoot '

documents.title: 'i 'd shoot you if i had a gun '
text: 'i 'd shoot you if i had a gun '

documents.title: essex put themselves on brink of title
text: essex put themselves on brink of title

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 tomorrow , but keep an eye out here for more updates this evening and into the morning .

documents.title: midlands today
text: police are investigating after a video of an officer heard to make racial comments to a member of the public in coventry was posted on social media .
the officer , who has `` already expressed remorse '' , has been removed from front-line duties pending further assessment , west midlands police said .
join me for bbc midlands today from 18:30 on bbc one .
author: Mary Rhodes
Presenter, BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: watch : latest weather forecast
text: there will be further showers this evening , though the winds will be lighter than last night .
lows of 8c ( 46f ) .
thursday will be breezy and cool again .
there will be a few heavy showers around but these will be less frequent than they have been in recent days .
highs of 16c ( 61f ) .
author: Shefali Oza
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: pm backs commonwealth games bid
text: the prime minister theresa may says the commonwealth games could present `` a unique opportunity for the west midlands '' .
birmingham won the right to be named the uk 's perferred bidder for the games and now goes up against kuala lumpur to stage the event .
if successful , coventry 's ricoh arena will host the netball competition .

the next step is for birmingham to demonstrate value for money in their bid but subject to that , i have no doubt birmingham will continue the uk 's rich history of hosting successful sporting events . ''

documents.title: prisoner slams 'cleavage police ' after partner 'refused ' visit
text: an inmate at a prison near rugby has claimed his partner was refused visitation - over her summer dress .
author: Coventry Telegraph

documents.title: unemployment falls
text: latest unemployment figures show the number of people out of work across the west midlands fell by 2,000 in the three months to july .
a total of 164,000 were out of work .
nationally the number of jobless now stands at 1.46 million - its lowest level since 1975 .
author: BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: ian paterson : victims of disgraced surgeon get £ 37m
text: about 750 victims of rogue breast surgeon ian paterson are to be paid compensation from a new £ 37m fund .
private healthcare firm spire has agreed to pay £ 27.2m , with £ 10m coming from paterson 's insurers and the heart of england nhs trust .
paterson was found guilty of 17 counts of wounding with intent in april after a trial at nottingham crown court .
in august , he had his 15-year jail term increased to 20 years after the appeal court ruled his term was too lenient .
the payments concern patients treated at private spire healthcare hospitals in the west midlands , who paterson worked for when he carried out hundreds of botched operations .

documents.title: coventry 's sporting world rocked by sudden death of former jets coach gerry mcmanus
text: coventry 's biggest sporting clubs are mourning the loss of a truly wonderful '' man following the death of gerry mcmanus .
author: Coventry Telegraph

documents.title: police patrols after travellers set up camp
text: police say they have patrols in the area after governors at a nuneaton primary school decided to close until further notice due to travellers setting up camp outside the school gates .
in a message on the camp hill primary website , governors said : this is to safeguard our pupils , staff and families . ''
warwickshire police said it was `` offering support '' and has patrols in the area .

documents.title: football : andreu will miss rest of season
text: sky blues striker tony andreu will miss the rest of the season .
the summer signing [ above ] , who left norwich city by mutual consent , injured his anterior cruciate ligament in the victory over port vale at the weekend .
peter vincenti , who scored in tuesday 's 2-0 home win over carlisle , said it was a blow to lose the frenchman .
[ i 'm ] absolutely gutted for him .
[ he 's ] a very tidy player and it just seemed so innocuous .
that 's why i think everyone 's a bit shocked at the minute [ at ] the damage that was caused

documents.title: this land in coventry could be sold for student accommodation
text: interest in a plot of land in stokeundefined- which already has planning permission for student accommodationundefined- is expected to be huge when it goes under the auctioneer 's hammer later this month .
author: Coventry Telegraph

documents.title: reaction following school closure after travellers set up camp
text: people have been reacting following the closure of a nuneaton primary school after travellers set up camp outside the school gates .
governors at camp hill primary made what they called the `` difficult decision '' to close until further notice .
in a message on the school website , they said : this is to safeguard our pupils , staff and families . ''
people have been giving their views on facebook :
u have done the right thing in my eyes yes it will upset a few who need to find child care but for me and the safety of my children u have done the best xx
the schools hands are tied and have made the only decision they could in these circumstances .
it 's time something was put in place to prevent this , and stop the teachers , students and families being put in this situation
i respect the fact you 've closing the school yes it 's the right thing to do .
but this needs sorting it 's getting stupid

documents.title: petition calling for edwardian boating lake to be restored
text: more than 200 people have signed a petition calling for an edwardian boating lake to be restored in one of coventry 's oldest formal parks .
the 100m-long lake in nauls mill park , coundon , has been left empty by the council in recent winters to prevent people from ice skating or putting themselves at risk if the water freezes .
four years ago a decision was made to drain the naturally-fed lake because the concrete lining had cracked and perished and water was leaking upstream .
the repair is estimated to be £ 104,000 .
author: BBC Coventry & Warwickshire

documents.title: daly in contention for harlequins match
text: wasps boss dai young says a couple of his international stars are in contention for their clash with harlequins at the ricoh this weekend .
wasps are joint top of the aviva premiership and one of only three teams that have a 100 % record so far this season .
young says lions winger elliot daly [ above ] is likely to be back and could be joined by a fellow british and irish lion .
james haskell 's not far off .
i think if james haskell is not fit this week , [ it 'll ] be next week .
i think thomas young will probably be fit next week , not this week
author: BBC Coventry & Warwickshire Sport

documents.title: new electric taxi unveiled at frankfurt motor show
text: the brand new electric taxi which is being built at ansty , near coventry , has been unveiled at the frankfurt motor show .
it 's being produced by the london electric vehicle company [ levc ] , formerly london taxi international or lti .
levc chief executive chris gubby has told bbc coventry and warwickshire it is expecting a lot of interest by 2020 .
in terms of specific forecasts for next year , obviously we 're not sharing that at the moment .
we have put out there that we 'd expect by 2020 to be in the order of around [ the ] 10,000-a-year mark
author: BBC Coventry & Warwickshire

documents.title: coventry city ceo hints at improving ricoh arena relationship and says resolving stadium issue is 'priority '
text: coventry city chief executive dave boddy has hinted that there 's an improving relationship with the ricoh arena , owned by premiership rugby club wasps , as the sky blues play out their last season at the stadium under their current agreement .
author: Coventry Telegraph

documents.title: school closed after travellers set up camp
text: a nuneaton primary school will remain closed today after travellers set up camp outside the school gates yesterday afternoon .
governors at camp hill primary made what they called the `` difficult decision '' this morning to close until further notice .
in a message on the school website they said : this is to safeguard our pupils , staff and families .
i hope that you support this difficult decision . ''
the school was shut in april when cleaning up took place at a site on nearby land that was occupied by travellers .
author: BBC Coventry & Warwickshire

documents.title: number of children going missing from care up by 80 %
text: the number of children going missing from care in warwickshire has increased by more than 80 % this year .

figures from warwickshire police show between april and june there were 312 reports of runaways over that time , with the number of children repeatedly absconding from care increasing by more than a quarter .
dr karen shalev greene , from the centre for the study of missing persons , said the system needed to change .

every time that they go missing there would be a reason that has not been resolved which leads them to go missing again and it 's the responsibility of the system to understand what the issues are , sort them out for the child with the child and if we do that correctly , then they wo n't go missing again
author: Michelle Dawes
BBC Coventry & Warwickshire

documents.title: football : the sky blues 'much better ' after half-time
text: the sky blues ' manager mark robins admitted it took a while for his players to take hold of the game following the 2-0 home win over carlisle in league two .
duckens nazon and peter vincenti scored second-half goals as coventry moved up to fourth place in the table .
we came out , second half was much better and we 've ended up with a lot of shots , a lot of opportunities and really two great goals
author: BBC Coventry & Warwickshire Sport

documents.title: weather update - warnings lifted
text: today , blustery conditions will steadily ease over the course of the day .
expect a mixture of bright spells and scattered showers .
highs of17c ( 63f ) .

it 'll be cloudy tonight with aband of rain steadily moving southwards in the early hours.lows of7c ( 45f ) .it 'll be cloudy tomorrow with the chance of isolated showers and some brighter spells where the cloud thins and breaks .
highs of 18c ( 59f ) .
author: Alex Hamilton
BBC Weather

documents.title: police officer 'heard to make racial comments to member of the public '
text: police are investigating after a video of an officer heard to make racial comments to a member of the public was posted on social media .
the constable was heard to make comments during a search of premises in coventry on 24 august , west midlands police said .

the force said it had received an official complaint , referred the matter to the independent police complaints commission and officers from its own professional standards department were investigating .
the officer has been removed from front-line duties `` pending further assessment '' .
assistant chief constable alex murray said : the officer has already expressed remorse and is very apologetic over his comments . ''

documents.title: coventry bin collections change this week - here 's what you need to know
text: new bin collection dates come into force around the city from this week .
author: Coventry Telegraph

documents.title: football : the sky blues fourth after win
text: the sky blues climbed into the league two play-off places , after beating carlisle 2-0 at the ricoh arena .
duckens nazon and peter vincenti hit second-half goals .
the haitian emphatically fired home three minutes after the restart before vincenti made the game safe with 10 minutes to go .
coventry are now 4th in the table .

some wind gusts of over 60mph overnight from # stormaileen but only 40-50mph locally .

new due to a tree blocking the railway between coventry and nuneaton trains running between these stations may be delayed .

documents.title: christopher eccleston to play macbeth in new rsc season
text: christopher eccleston has signed up to star in a `` thrillingly dark '' and `` modern '' production of shakespeare 's macbeth .
the ex-doctor who actor , 53 , will be making his royal shakespeare company ( rsc ) debut in the role .
unveiling its summer 2018 season , the company also launched a fundraising campaign for the restoration and redevelopment of the rsc 's costume workshop at the company 's stratford-upon-avon home .
macbeth with christopher eccleston and niamh cusack directed by polly findlay plays from 13 mar - 18 sep # rscmacbeth

1 week only , but hey !
does it get a cinema screening too ?
hi margaret , great to hear you renewed !
# rscmacbeth will be playing in cinemas on 11 april .
please check with local cinemas for more info

time i saw mr eccles on stage again.he was great @ twitterid # antigone

it will feel cooler than yesterday - highs of 16c ( 61f ) .
